reviews.review: half life but in source

"Das Spiel fängt genau so seltsam/anders an, wie es auch endet."

Damit, begrüsse ich euch herzlich zu meiner subjektiven Kritik an Half-Life Source

Half Life Source, war meine erste grosse selbst spielende Erfahrung mit dem Half Life Franchise.
Ich kannte die Story, ich kannte allgemein die Spiele und die Story rund um das Half-Life (Portal) Universum und wollte unbedingt mal von diesem Stück Videospielgeschichte auch ein Stück abhaben in dem ich das erste Half-Life mit der Source-Engine spielte. 

Ich muss trotz der vielen Kritik an Half-Life Source sagen, dass das Spiel für mich ein gut durcharbeitetes Spiel ist, in dem das Wasser, die Lichteffekte und die Ragdolle-Player Modelle super zum Spiel passen und ich es mir ohne gar nicht mehr  vorstellen möchte. Einziger grosser Kritikpunkt ist, dass in Xen bei mir gewisse Partikel von Aliens nur als Schwarzes Feld angezeigt wurden.

Im grossen und ganzen würde ich, sei es Half-Life,Half-Life Source,Half-Life 2, Half Life Alyx, jedem Empfeheln der einerseits Lust an packender Atmosphäre mit einem Action-Spektakel gekürt mit einer packenden Story, das Spiel einmal spielen zu sollen.
 Aber auch für die jenigen, die einfach nur die grosse Shotterrevolution  einmal spielen wollen. 

Ich gebe dem Spiel 8/10 für die Charaktere, die Story, die Atmosphäre und dem Mut von Valve.

Bleibt gesund (:

The original is way better. Some events are totally broken. Music stops playing if you switch levels because music is broken in the Source engine. To be honest, there's not a huge graphical difference, either. If you want to play Half-Life with better graphics, just get Black Mesa.

do not buy this for the half life experience. buy this so you can have half life 1 content in garry's mod. Half Life runs on the goldsource engine, so it cannot be added to gmod, a source game. if you do not own garry's mod, there is no point in buying this version.
Plus, before you decide this should never have been made in the first place, remember, Freeman's Mind and HLVR:AI would not have been possible without this game

I never played this game until recently acquiring it through a Half-Life bundle (and I have been interested in playing HL2, but didn't want to proceed to that game until I completed the first). I was 8 at the time of this game's release, but I did play other games around it's time (including Unreal Tournament and Counter Strike). Considering the context around that time for FPS titles, I think this game was rather revolutionary at the time. However, perhaps it is just HL: Source or Half-Life all-together, but the response from the bosses and enemies as to how they received damage seemed rather...difficult to ascertain entirely until they died. All in all, this game was entertaining, but not for the faint of heart (gory and has some good scares).

basically just goldsrc hl1 but with a shit ton of bugs

There are lots of problems, the lift in Anomalous Materials doesn't make a sound, loading screens are slow compared to the original, the scientist in that test room is floating in thin air, the crowbar sounds like metal when hitting WOOD! In We've Got Hostiles, the H.E.C.U. don't kill the scientists, the sky in this level with the snipers doesn't work properly, during residue processing, the sky bursts through the map, the weapons are too reflective and worse still, they even bothered to add the HD models from Blue Shift and they're even more reflective and I only scratched the surface of what is bad in this game. If you want a true remake, then check out Black Mesa or just buy Half-Life if you never played it, then buy it rather than choosing this shit, you could get this thing for free and still want you money back!!! Valve, pls fix!

a really clasic

the good:

1. HD models look extra HD in Source engin.

2. water and shaders look much better

3. movement feels  much smoother.

4. (optional) You can mount onto Gmod

The terrible:

1. several reoccurring Bugs/glitches down to the bone

2. hitboxes seem to be smaller

3. smg Recoil is awkward and messes up your aim

4. Some enemies, like the Helicopter and Gonarch seem almost immune to certain weapons

5. Ai seems to rush you on site or just ignore you behind glass even when you're right infront of them, which seems to mess up certain parts of the game, when its trying to either convey a message to the player or if the player has to fight the enemies in a map a certain way.

Unless you want to mount it onto Garry's mod, don't bother with it. It boggles me on just how could valve publish such a broken and lazily put together excuse of a game. You're better of playing Either the original if you want a true Half life experience, or if you want great remaster go play Black Mesa.
